value.title: DAX Fridays! #15: SWITCH
value.excerpt: Learn how to use the function SWITCH in DAX/ Powerpivot. Switch is the equivalent of IF but it has easier syntax and therefore it is easier to read. value.title: DAX Fridays! #183: How to deal with multiple dates in Power BI
value.excerpt: So you have order date, shipped date, required date....and only one calendar. How do you manage that in power bi and DAX? value.title: DAX Fridays! #21: USERELATIONSHIP
value.excerpt: A common example in a Power BI table is to have multiple dates, which are related to the same Date table. As you are limited to one active relationship, we need to use the DAX function USERELATIONSHIP to manage the inactive relationships.  Link to Power BI file: https://curbal.com/blog/glossary/userelationship-dax

value.excerpt: In this video we will go through the DAX function TREATAS. value.title: DAX Fridays! #80: DATESBETWEEN
value.excerpt: In todays video we are going to cover the DAX function DATESBETWEEN.  DATESBETWEEN function allows you to calculate amounts between two dates you specify.
